title: Alerts
description: Provide contextual feedback messages for typical user actions with the handful of available and flexible alert messages.

title: Buttons
description: Use the button classes on an <a>, <button>, or <input> element.

title: Forms
description: We designed them to show clearly the form state through the user flow.

title: Try Banner
description: The main call to action to signup.

title: Jumbotron
description: Use the .has-header modifier when used with the transparent header over it.

title: Header
description: We try to keep the header in all apps and websites that we do.

title: Footer
description: We try to keep the footer in all apps and websites that we do.

title: Modals
description: Toggle a modal via JavaScript by clicking the button below. It will slide down and fade in from the top of the page.

title: Tables
description: Use tables to represent tabulated data.

title: Labels
description: Labels are used to provide additional information about something.

title: Navs
description: Use the .nav-center modifier to center the elements in the list.

title: Showcase Tabs
description: Used mostly on landing pages to showcase products or features.

title: Spinner
description: We use spinner after apply opacity to the main container between .3s and .7s. After that we show the spinner.

title: Breadcrumb
description:
Used for showing where is the user inside the application.

Use the .has-homepage modifier to show the home icon before the first element.

title: Cards
description: A card is a flexible and extensible content container.

title: Code Picker
description: Used for showing code examples in different languages.

title: UI Switch
description: We designed it to quickly turn in/off features on Dashboard.

title: Scope
description: We designed it to easily show scope toggling.

title: Switchboard
description:
In order to enable and disable feature we suggest to use swichboard.

Use the .switchboard-responsive modifier for the responsive version.

title: Phone Mockup
description: We use this mockup for wrapping mobile screenshots.
